\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 30418}

\subsection*{A Legal Addiction}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Moon}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 3.5 ml & IM & Pharms - Buprenorphine & liquid\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 155.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
I used buprenorphine to detox from dope - it was a relatively painless procedure - it basically cut my detox symptoms by 3/4. I still felt a bit bad, but I could function.



My problems arose due to my  Doctor's subscribing a huge amount of bup for the detox- two years later I am off the `hard' stuff but still injecting 1-2 vials of bup a day\ldots  admittedly cheaper than heroin, and I function better than on methadone but BE CAREFUL!  Buprenex is a highly addictive drug, and the withdrawal is even worse than heroin- for the casual user, there is hardly any high to mention, thus not even worth trying.



\ldots this warning is for the dope addicts considering going onto buprenorphine- be sure you go to a good doctor who will limit your prescriptions, and use naltrexone- otherwise you will be facing years of relapse and a new, (at least) legal addiction.

\end{document}
